Sado Rituals.title: Accusations from Demonic Spirits in the Air
Sado Rituals.about:
Inspired by the book "The Soul After Death" by Fr. Seraphim Rose and the belief held by some in the Eastern Orthodox Church which states that "following a person's death the soul leaves the body, and is escorted to God by angels. During this journey the soul passes through an aerial realm, which is inhabited by wicked spirits (Ephesians 6:12). The soul encounters these demons at various points referred to as toll-houses where the demons then attempt to accuse it of sin and, if possible, drag the soul into hell".
Find the whole book here:
dn721807.ca.archive.org/0/items/fr.-seraphim-rose-the-soul-after-death-2009/Fr.%20Seraphim%20Rose%20-%20The%20Soul%20After%20Death%20-%202009.pdf
Quick Wiki reference:
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_toll_house
Recorded in June 2025.
sadorituals.bandcamp.com
instagram.com/gatesofhypnosandsadorituals
facebook.com/SadoRituals
Nearly hour long, doomy ambient noise wall inspired by the Orthodox Christian belief describing the struggle of the soul after physical death, when it ascends in the air approaching the hordes of unclean spirits trying to drag it to hell. Be warned, for the end is coming. Inspired by the book "The Soul After Death" by Fr. Seraphim Rose.
Originally released by MILITANT LITURGY:
militantliturgy.bandcamp.com
Sado Rituals.credits:
released June 23, 2025
Picture used for cover art: Death of Theodora, spiritual student of Basil the Younger, and visions of spiritual trials, Public Domain.

[ANG MC09/2021]
Ups... It seems I forgot to re-post this split of mine with Hana Haruna released four years ago :). So here it finally is. It has been released on tape by befriended Polish label Antenna Non Grata and I must say it's the most proffesional labal I ever worked with. All their releases are quality made regular CDs carrying a huge variety of experimental and avant-garde stuff. Be sure to check great tape series "Make noise great again" featuring Dosis Letalis, Vilgoć, Radio Noise Duo and others! Also, you harsh noise criminals, you can buy something artsy for your sensitive ladies instead presenting them another filthy HNW tape with dead bodies on the frost. It's Women's day, for God's sake! :)
Now please go there and buy stuff - shipping costs from Poland are still very low!

Sado Rituals.title: Burning the Wickerman
Sado Rituals.about:
Crepuscular Rituals - Burning the Wickerman
A wicker man was purportedly a large wicker statue in which the druids (priests of Celtic paganism) sacrificed humans and animals by burning. The main evidence for this practice is a sentence by Roman general Julius Caesar in his Commentary on the Gallic War (1st century BC), which modern scholarship has linked to an earlier Greek writer, Poseidonius.
There is some archaeological evidence of human sacrifice among Celtic peoples, although it is rare.The ancient Greco-Roman sources are now regarded somewhat skeptically, considering it is likely they "were eager to transmit any bizarre and negative information" about the Celts, as it benefited them to do so.
Recorded on May, the 1st 2023 at the Wickerman ceremony by the High Priests of Crepuscular Rituals:
Ken Jamison - High Frequency Evocator of Solar Energies
Emperor Sadox - Commander of Crawling Drones and Tectonic Eruptions
Originally released on Gates of Hypnos and Basement Corner Emissions:
gatesofhypnos.bandcamp.com
basementcorner.bandcamp.com
Sado Rituals.credits:
released June 24, 2023
Source picture used for cover art: The burning of a 40ft wickerman at Butser Ancient Farm by Fiendfall.

Sado Rituals.title: Eldfathers' Eve
Sado Rituals.about:
Dziady (pl.; Belarusian: Дзяды, lit. "grandfathers, eldfathers", sometimes translated as Forefathers' Eve) is a term in Slavic folklore for the spirits of the ancestors and a collection of pre-Christian rites, rituals and customs that were dedicated to them. The essence of these rituals was the "communion of the living with the dead", namely, the establishment of relationships with the souls of the ancestors, periodically returning to their homes from the times of their lives. The aim of the ritual activities was to win the favor of the deceased, who were considered to be caretakers in the sphere of fertility.
Crepuscular Rituals are:
Ken Jamison (Crepuscular Entity, Hana Haruna, Basement Corner Emissions) and Sadox (Sado Rituals, Gates of Hypnos).
Originally released as a co-release between Gates of Hypnos and Basement Corner Emissions.

Sado Rituals.title: Extracting the Secret Name of Ra
Sado Rituals.about:
"Isis and the Name of Ra
A Ramesside incantation to remove poison from a patient
From the Middle Kingdom on, narrative episodes involving gods and goddesses were used among the strategies of healing, as incantations to secure or restore good health. One such 'myth' found on several Ramesside sources is the tale of Isis and the Name of Ra. (...)
In this tale, Isis forms a clay snake with spittle dribbled by the ageing sun-god, the creator Ra. When the snake bites Ra, only Isis can save him, but she does this only when Ra reveals his secret name to her. He does this on condition that she reveal it only to her son Horus."
Source:  www.ucl.ac.uk/museums-static/digitalegypt/literature/isisandra.html
Originally released by Gates of Hypnos:  gatesofhypnos.bandcamp.com

Sado Rituals.title: Funeral of Winter
Sado Rituals.about:
Conceptual work dedicated to Marzanna (Polish), Slavic goddes of winter. She is an ancient goddess associated with winter's death and rebirth and dreams. In ancient Slavic rites, the death of the Goddess Marzanna at the end of winter becomes the rebirth of Spring of the Goddess Kostroma (Russian), Lada or Vesna representing the coming of Spring.
Marzanna is also the name used to describe the effigy of the goddess, which was ritually burned or drowned during an early spring rite called Jare Święto in order to hasten the approach of spring. The custom of drowning the effigy of Marzanna derives from sacrificial rites; its function was to ensure a good harvest in the upcoming year. Following the principles of sympathetic magic – as described by James Frazer – it was believed that burning an effigy representing the goddess of death would remove any results of her presence (i.e., the winter) and thus bring about the coming of spring.
Crepuscular Rituals are:
Ken Jamison (Crepuscular Entity, Hana Haruna, Basement Corner Emissions) and Sadox (Sado Rituals, Gates of Hypnos).
Originally co-released by Basement Corner Emissions and Gates of Hypnos.

gatesofhypnos.bandcamp.com
facebook.com/GATESofHYPNOS

Sado Rituals.title: Interdimensional transmissions of supernatural knowledge channeled by the 11th incarnation of the Grand Wizard of Booze
Sado Rituals.about:
New one from Sado's side project dedicated to untamed, harsh noise fun, filthy, old school sound and shameless mockery of social trends of nowadays. This one attacks (with laughter) the facade "spirituality" and present an unintended, co-incidental developement of LaM's style - forgot to be lazy at moments and recorded on heavy, insomnia-causing and mind-affecting meds.
Recorded within about 24 hours period between May 31st and June 1st, Anno Domini 2025.

Sado Rituals.title: Kraken
Sado Rituals.about:
Sado Rituals
"Atavistic Withdrawal" refers to the concept of "basic perinatal matrices" (BPM) by Czech-born psychiatrist Stanislav Grof. BPM I, called "The Amniotic Universe" is the original symbiotic unity of the fetus with the maternal organism. Elements of this state can be accompanied with, or alternate with, experiences of a lack of boundaries and obstructions, such as the ocean and the cosmos. The extreme expression of the sacred and spiritual quality of BPM I is the experience of cosmic unity and the unio mystica.
According to Brazilian occultist Marcel Ramos Motta, the fetus in the prenatal period repeats the evolutionary journey from a single cell to "homo sapiens" - recreating, in the first three months after fertilization, the structures of insects, fish, amphibians, birds and mammals.
Recorded in July 2022.
IO
"Everything has been arranged in the body by fire, in a manner suited to itself, in imitation of the whole, from small to large and from large to small (mikra pros megala kai megala pros mikra). Dry and wet, giving to everyone and taking from everyone, with the force of the sea, the creatures that suit it, killing the ones that don't. Cold and wet water is arranged around it, a passage for cold breath and hot breath, an imitation of the earth, which alters everything that falls on it."
Corpus Hippocraticum
linktr.ee/iovisualartist
Recorded in July 2022.
Originally released by The Church of Noisy Goat:
thechurchofnoisygoat.bandcamp.com
Sado Rituals.credits:
released July 24, 2022
Cover artwork by IO

A huge, three hours long work about falling into depression, helplessness and desperate efforts to dig out of this black hole. Slowly developing, layer-shifting ambient and harsh noise walling with a collaborative, static part in the middle. A thing to sink within and battle your inner demons, but the result remains up to you.

Sado Rituals.title: Sado Rituals / Interzona
Sado Rituals.about:
Sado Rituals
Recorded in June 2022.
Interzona
Hardworking noise/industrial act formed by Jean Souza (Suzana´s Bauten) for exploring the most extreme antimusic. His main influences are beat literature, abstract art, Dada, Surrealism and others, with big names as Burroughs, Modrian and Kandinsky.
Musically near of japanoise mindmasters as Merzbow, Hijokaidan, Hatanahashi, C.C.C.C, Violent Onsen Geisha and noise rock monsters as Swans, Big Black, Sonic Violence, without forgetting old-school industrial, free jazz, extreme metal, extreme punk and all the underground scene that celebrates noisiest sound violence.
Cyberpunk, obscure literature and hard sci-fi inspire Interzona, which name is taken from Naked Lunch. Philip K. Dick, Ignácio de Loyola Brandão and William Gibson are recurring because they paints an empty and hopeless world, without any chance of getting better days.
Field recording, extensive and not orthodox use of Digital Audio Workstation for deconstruct
Interzona:  plasmodiumverminal@gmail.com

Cover art composed out of two pictures from:
Illuminated Manuscript, Gospels, Walters Art Museum Ms. W.592, fol. 157a
This illuminated and illustrated Arabic manuscript of the Gospels by Matthew (Mattá), Mark (Marquṣ), Luke (Lūqā), and John (Yūḥannā) was copied in Egypt by Ilyās Bāsim Khūrī Bazzī Rāhib, who was most likely a Coptic monk, in Anno Mundi 7192 / 1684 CE. The text is written in naskh in black ink with rubrics in red.
Left side: Jesus raises a widow’s son at Nain.
Right side: The Crucifixion.
Source links:

Sado Rituals.title: The Birth of the Sun
Sado Rituals.about:
Gody, (Russian Коляда́) - in the Slavic tradition, a holiday celebrating the winter solstice, preceded by the Generous Evening. The victory of light over darkness symbolizes the time when day begins to grow and night begins to wane - thus bringing hope, optimism and joy to people.
Crepuscular Rituals is Crepuscular Entity and Sado Rituals collab project focused on psychedelic drones and noise.

Sado Rituals.title: The Final Harvest
Sado Rituals.about:
The September equinox (or southward equinox) is the moment when the Sun appears to cross the celestial equator, heading southward.
In Slavic Paganism this date was indicating the harvest festival - the feast was initially associated with the cult of plants, trees and agriculture.
In the modern western Pagan tradition the holiday of the autumnal equinox is a ritual of thanksgiving for the fruits of the earth and a recognition of the need to share them to secure the blessings of the Goddess and the Gods during the coming winter months.

Sado Rituals.title: The Flight into Egypt
Sado Rituals.about:
"The Flight into Egypt" is a concept album based on a story recounted in the Gospel of Matthew (Matthew 2:13–23). Recorded in May 2025.
The Desert Fathers is a collab project between Scott Lawlor and His Haunted Humming.

scottlawlor.bandcamp.com
His Haunted Humming:
sadorituals.bandcamp.com
instagram.com/gatesofhypnosandsadorituals

Three dark drone ambient tracks covered with ANW textures. A concept album based on Biblical events recounted in the Gospel of Matthew and provided by new collab project between Scott Lawlor and His Haunted Humming (Sado Rituals). A long, complex and evocative work to aid your study and contemplation over the Holy Scriptures.

Sado Rituals.title: The Law
Sado Rituals.about:
Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of the bones of the dead and everything unclean. In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous. And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’ So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets. Go ahead, then, and complete what your ancestors started!
You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?
- Matthew 23:27-33
Recorded in February 2024.
Originally released by Gates of Hypnos:
gatesofhypnos.bandcamp.com
Sado Rituals.credits:
released February 16, 2024
Source painting used for cover art: Christ among the Pharisees by Jacob Jordaens (1593–1678). Public Domain.
Opening sample took from The Chosen TV series.

Sado Rituals.title: The Shortest Night
Sado Rituals.about:
Kupala Night, (Belarusian: Купалле, Polish: Noc Kupały, Russian: Иван-Купала, Ukrainian: Івана Купала), also called Ivanа-Kupala, is a traditional Slavic holiday that was originally celebrated on the shortest night of the year, which is on 21-22 of June. The celebration relates to the summer solstice when nights are the shortest and includes a number of Slavic rituals.
Many of the rites related to this holiday are connected with the role of water in fertility and ritual purification. On Kupala day, young people jump over the flames of bonfires in a ritual test of bravery and faith. The failure of a couple in love to complete the jump, while holding hands, is a sign of their destined separation. Girls may float wreaths of flowers (often lit with candles) on rivers, and attempt to gain foresight into their romantic relationship fortune from the flow patterns of the flowers on the river. Men may attempt to capture the wreaths, in the hope of capturing the interest of the woman who floated it.
There is an ancient Kupala belief that the eve of Ivan Kupala is the only time of the year when ferns bloom. Prosperity, luck, discernment, and power befall whom ever finds a fern flower. Therefore, on that night, village folk roam through the forests in search of magical herbs, and especially, the elusive fern flower. Traditionally, unmarried women, signified by the garlands in their hair, are the first to enter the forest. They are followed by young men. Therefore, the quest to find herbs and the fern flower may lead to the blooming of relationships between pairs within the forest.
Crepuscular Rituals are:
Ken Jamison (Crepuscular Entity, Hana Haruna, Basement Corner Emissions) and Sadox (Sado Rituals, Gates of Hypnos).
This is a co-release between Gates of Hypnos and Basement Corner Emissions.
Sado Rituals.credits:
released June 30, 2021
Cover illustration edited from:
I. Sokolov. Kupala Night. 1856.

Sado Rituals.title: Zaraza
Sado Rituals.about:
Source samples by Sadox of Sado Rituals.
Cover art by Lily of Plastic Alter.
Sado Rituals.credits:
released March 28, 2020
Album is dedicated to victims of coronavirus as well their families and friends.
Sadox (Sado Rituals) would like to thank Lily (Plastic Alter) for everlasting friendship and support during the creative process.
Lily (Plastic Alter) would like to declare, that Sado Rituals can be a portal for you to collapse and spiral within your deepest buried trauma.
